result.execSummary:
The defendant James P Pabelick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber. Sentence credit of 33 days were granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

No Violent Contact with the victim or witnesses listed in the criminal complaint. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant James P Pabelick in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Williams Buttery request more time to review discovery.   Court adjours. Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant James P Pabelick in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Buttery requests an additional court date as she was just appointed to this case.  Court adjourns.  Attorney Buttery requests bail modification. Court requests written motion to be filed.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant James P Pabelick in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant to see public defender.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the witness listed in the complaint.   Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.

Defendant James P Pabelick in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
